titlestmt.titleproper: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Bicentennial Exhibit records 1975-1975
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Bicentennial Exhibit records

bioghist.p: To celebrate the nationâ€™s bicentennial, the Academy of Natural Sciences put together an exhibit on the history of the natural sciences in the United States since 1776. Researchers Mark Rothenberg and Amy Marder compiled background historical and contemporary narratives that were used in the planning and construction of the bicentennial exhibit.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of manuscripts of background papers on the history of and contemporary topics in natural science. These papers were prepared by Mark Rothenberg and Amy Marder in 1975.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
